page.title: 05The Church in Strathmiglo
page.content: The parish church of Strathmiglo was built in 1784 and is situated at the east end of the village.It replaced an earlier church dedicated to St.Martin. In early writings Strathmiglo was referred to as "Eglismartin" meaning "Church of St.Martin".Above the porch of the church is a stone with the inscription ,"Jesus Christ is the door and he that enters in be him shal be saved. John 10 9 1647".The stone is all that remains of the original church.The church has a membership of about 350.A service is held every Sunday.A Sunday School is held for children up to 12 years old.Children over 12 can go to Sunday at Six where topics of general interest are discussed.The grave yard is divided into 2 parts,old and new.The oldest grave is dated 1681.There is also a Free Church of Strathmiglo.
